name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

strengths: Exceptional 20 damage for 1 Colorless Energy is among the best damage ratios in the game
Zero retreat cost provides unmatched mobility and flexibility
Colorless typing allows it to fit into any deck composition
Psychic resistance gives it an edge against Psychic Pokemon
Evolves into Raticate which can deal massive damage with Super Fang
weaknesses: Extremely low 30 HP means it can be knocked out by almost any attack
Fighting weakness leaves it vulnerable to popular Fighting Pokemon
Only one attack limits strategic options
Cannot survive most attacks even from other Basic Pokemon
Fragility makes it difficult to keep in play long enough to evolve
synergies: Use PlusPower to boost Bite to 30 damage and secure more knockouts
Defender can help Rattata survive one extra hit to continue attacking
Gust of Wind brings out weak benched Pokemon that Rattata can knock out
Zero retreat cost pairs perfectly with Switch strategies and bench manipulation
counters: Machop - Fighting weakness and decent HP make this impossible
Onix - Cannot deal meaningful damage to 90 HP, will be crushed
Sandshrew - Fighting type advantage and better HP
